Reviews.Title: “just perfect for those who just want to sleep there”
Reviews.Author: CrissTee
Reviews.Content: I been there this year with one BFF and it was just fine, I didn't like the ideea of sleeping with more people in the room but finaly it was cool, we now have new friends and nice memories. If you are looking for comfort, this is not your place, but if you like cheap visits with lots of fun and people this is the right place to stay. I payed less than I would pay in my city for a hotel night in the subs. Coclusion. I say it is just perfect for 7.5 punds/ night, with this money I eat lunch here :)) :D

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: Boombafam
Reviews.Content: Belated review from stay in Mar 2006. Since prices in London are outrageous no matter what, this was what I expected for the money: the price of 4 days in London was more than 7 days in the Caribbean, just a month before. Rooms small but clean enough. We had a basement room but there was a basement type window. It actually allowed decent privacy and low noise for a city room. Would recommend for a budget stay where your main focus is spending time away from the hotel and it's only used for sleeping/showering.

Reviews.Title: “so bad it was farcical!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug0251
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights recently. Absolutely awful! Room was shabby and dusty. Television did not work. Curtains in window were patrially off the hooks so curtains did not close fully. Toilet only flushed after three or four attempts. T.iles were cracked in the bathroom. This hotel is so awful it is farcical. The only good thing about this hotel is that it is in central London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, No Maintainence”
Reviews.Author: shashankjoshi7
Reviews.Content: The owners of this hotel probably realise that they have an excellent location. They know that the property is not too large to fill and given the locational advantage (Baker Street tube station is 5min walking distance) they will always get idiots like me who will pay GBP 100 + for a lousy room. Would still consider this as you do not get too many better options for this price in Central London. But if you do, pls stay away. The hotel staff is not arrogant but has a "you need me, I don't need you" kind of attitude. Expect a basic room with barely clean toilets. No elevators, cramped corridor. Wodden structure and Road facing so noise levels can be disturbing. If the idea is to explore London from a central location and use the hotel to just come back late at night and crash then book. Else please use the review and stay away !

Reviews.Title: “only if you are desperate”
Reviews.Author: mamaspy
Reviews.Content: you could class this as 'shabby chic' but forget the chic. forget it if you are at all fussy as the floors needed a darn good vaccuuming stayed for 1 night very convenient location for a trip to wembley stadium/ baker st tube breakfast good and staff very polite Bed was very uncomfortable but no worse than a 4* I stayed in a few months ago value for money - never can tell in London!

Reviews.Title: “everything we needed, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location excellent. Room seemed a bit shabby on first look but proved to have everything two of us needed, comfortable beds, hot water, relatively quiet outlook (depends on which room, we used 3 over our 2 stays,) hair dryer, free safe, TV etc. Some rooms were pretty tight but still comfortable. Breakfast excellent, staff very helpful and courteous and friendly. Underground transport to Heath Row easy from Marylebone.Price a bargain for London and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place.”
Reviews.Author: Travelgal32
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 2 1/2 week stay at the Regent's Park Hotel. I was traveling by myself and I was given a double room. It was a pretty decent size room, with a big shower. I was given a room on the first floor in the back so I wasn't bothered by any traffic noise, but the floors on top were kind of squeeky so sometimes I was woken up by the noise. Breakfast was served in the restaurant next door and consisted of 3 kinds of cereals, meats, cheese, hard boiled eggs, fruit salad, tomato and lettuce salad, yougurt, croissants, and rolls, coffee and tea. Great way to start out a long day of site seeing. The restaurant next door (Malasian) was excellent if you are to tired to go out to eat. The Baker Street tube is a 5 minute walk from the hotel, as well as Tesco, a supermarket with great ready made sandwiches, pasta, and salads. I would definitly stay here again. The staff was great and helpful (the manager helped me lug my 2 suitcases upstairs).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dgflyer
Reviews.Content: Neighbourhood: This hotel is located in a pleasant area, close to two Underground stations (Baker Street and Marylebonne. Glouscester Place is a one way street that gets very busy from about 7a.m. until late in the evening. Our Room: Not bad. We (two people) were placed in a room for three. It was clean and comfortable. And, apart from the room needing a fresh coat of paint, we were happy for the extra space and good the good sized bathroom. The shower was a little tight. If you dropped the soap one would have to "plies" gracefully (like Anna Pavlova) to pick it up. The room was cleaned daily. Breakfast: Served in the adjacent Singaporean restaurant's main dining room on the basement level. We were very impressed with the massive atrium. The breakfast fare consisted of: cereals, yoghourt, fruit, croissants, cheese, juice, coffeee, etc... Staff: They were always very friendly and helpful. I had difficulty starting the heater, so I called for help and the concierege came immediately. Not a bad place to stay. I would seriously consider staying here again on future trips to LONDON.

Reviews.Title: “Keep your expectations realistic and you won't regret this.”
Reviews.Author: AgileDog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the tail end of a business trip for some personal travel days. After staying in one of the best hotels in the city, I was expecting the contrast to be difficult but keeping in mind the excellent price (67 GBP) I never regretted the decision. The room key is a long rectangular plastic card, about 1.5 the length and twice the thickness of a credit card. It unlocks the door mechanically and also must stay inserted in the room fusebox to activate electricity. Avoid the upper rooms if the weather is warm as they're warmer than the lower ones. My room had a standing fan but it made a lot of noise; there was a bit of a heat wave at the time so I resorted to sleeping under a wet towel, which worked pretty well. The bathroom had seen better days but was nonetheless functional. Soap and linen provided. No clock or alarm is available (not counting the TV), and the wake-up call service is unreliable; hence, a traveller's clock would be a good idea/purchase. Say hello to the parrot in the lobby, but keep your distance if you're standing nearby as the droppings splatter. Madame Tussaud's is within easy walking distance, as is an excellent pub, a camera store, and a cheap (1GBP per half hour) internet cafe, all south/southeast within 2-3 blocks. Several convenience stores within a block or two. If you are looking for good restaurants/pubs head South/Southeast about 6-7 blocks and just wander from there. Tube (Baker Street) is about 4-5 walk away. If you're not familiar with London, major attractions (West End, Leicester Square, etc.) are reachable within 15-20 minutes but you will have to transfer subway lines probably once. If you are a business traveller or don't mind the extra expense, avoid the hotel's taxi service as it was slow and took away from the time we'd allotted to check in early at the airport. Rather, hail a street cab (faster) or take the tube to Heathrow (cheaper). The bed was clean, the bathroom was clean and functional; both were cleaned daily. That's pretty much all I was looking for. If you are prepared for a few rough edges, you should be able to enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel near a beautiful park”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in Sep 2004, purchased for a good rate on expedia. The location is excellent - near baker street tube stop. Also within walking distance of the lovely Regents Park. There was some street noise in the room but not too bad. The beds were decent and the room was OK clean. Initially we had a problem with the plumbing but the staff were quick to help. All the staff I met were very friendly and helpful, one of the best things about this hotel. There was no lift but the staff were happy to help me with my luggage (which I did not experience in other hotels). Breakfast was decent as well. All in all a great stay and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good London hotel for your money. It's a little walk from the underground, but is close to a great stop with several connections. It is also very close to a great, inexpensive pub. The free breakfast was good - coffee or tea, meat and cheese for sandwiches, toast, crossants, hard boiled eggs, etc. The room was very small but clean. I'd definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelguru4u
Reviews.Content: The room was clean. The bathroom was as well. The bed was very comfortable. The area was excellent. The staff was helpful and friendly. It's a good budget hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go - dishonest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Small, smelly room. I have been duped with the payment ( a pc virus made two bookings for the same room) and the owner charged twice. Dishonest people, do not go there.

Reviews.Title: “A Birdlover's Idyll”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel -- it feels like my second home. I always stay at the Regents Park on my way back to America from overseas. The lobby has a feathered resident, Zilli the African Grey Parrot, who likes to chew up, oh, passports, credit cards, what have you...! The staff are quiet and friendly; they'll fix you up with a ride to the airport, or recommend a favorite London museum (try the Imperial War Museum). Rooms are small but complete. Get a room facing the back (Gloucester Place road noise). Good water pressure, good hot water. Food at adjoining Singapura restaurant is tasty; conti breakfast nice and filling. A quick walk to the Queen Mum's rose garden in Regent's Park. But the best part... is Zilli the bird!

Reviews.Title: “happy hoilday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me and wife stayed at the hoilday inn regents park.we found it very accessable to everything.oxford street was only 10 mins from the hotel,my wife found that great for all her shopping.all the staff where very helpful and friendly.the room was very clean,if a little small,but for the time we spent in it,it was ok.there was a huge breakfast menu,from fresh fruit,to cooked or cereuls.lots of info in the room,or down stairs.the food in the restaurant was very nice,and the prices where reasonable for london.all in all the staff at the hotel made our hoilday a very happy one.to all the staff a big thank you to you all.we will be staying there again when we come back to london. allan sheila ferguson

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel July 17-20th 2004 and booked it due to the previous reviews on this site. This hotel is well situated and is very comfortable and clean. The standard of service and room quality is much lower in London then elsewhere, but I felt that this property gave me value for my money. The only complaint I have was that it was hot during my stay, and unfortunately in order to get air into the room, we had to have the window open. As we were in the front of the hotel, we overlooked the street which is a very busy street with buses and cars running up it all night long. This would not bother me in the fall or winter, but if you stay in the summer I would suggest you ask for a back facing room. The breakfast was good, with a reasonable assortment of options, but the 10 cereals (only 3) and the pain au chocolate the other reviewer mention were not present during our stay, however it was varied enough for the 4 days we were there. Note for the English Breakfast you have to pay extra. I found the beds a little hard for my liking, but to each their own. The location is fantastic otherwise, very close to Baker Street Tube Station with lots of shops and restaurants all around. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loving the breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: PinkHaylz
Reviews.Content: We got there about 10am Friday, and our rooms were ready- even though the check in time is around 2 o clock! The rooms are a bit small, but enough space to move around in and very clean! Beds are comfy, enough channels on the TV (even French, Spanish, German and radio!) Movies are ?7-95 but they were all recent ones such as Pirates of the Caribbean and Matrix. You can also pay for a Playstation. Enough tea/coffee choices in the room and a sachet of Galaxy milk chocolate which went down well!! Minibar is expensive though! Didnt open it! Got woken up by a fire alarm 6-30am on Sat, but we were back in the building within 10mins, and in another 10mins, a letter of apology from the manager had arrived- was impressed! The breakfast choice was huge and tried nearly everything. Rolls, croissants, pain au chocolat, cereal (about 10kinds and toppings) fresh fruit, fruit salads, cheeses, ham, yogurt, cooked breakfast (everything)....list goes on!! Lots of info in the room, and downstairs. Friendly staff helped us and gave us a map. Only about 5-10mins walk from Oxford St. and up the road is the tube station and bus stop. Only gripe was when we tried to get on the internet in the hotel it wouldn't work, as you have to pay by card. The food in the restaurant is nice too, and prices are reasonable for London. Next door to the famous Portland Hospital!! A good deal!!

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: Scroller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the centre of London and also to one of the city's loveliest green spaces, Regent's Park. The rooms and studios are simply but comfortably furnished, and clean. Someone with a green thumb makes sure that plants flourish in all the public areas, even outside the entrance in February, and Zili -- a delightful parrot -- takes an intelligent interest in all the guests. Mohammed Asas, the manager, who presides over the reception desk by day, could easily double as a concierge at the Ritz. He is gracious and kind and gives excellent advice on every kind of practical problem; his shrewd shopping recommendations would do Which? (or Consumer Reports in the US) proud. For an alternative to the very good Malaysian and Chinese food in the downstairs restaurant, I suggest La Gauloise -- a 5-minute walk around the corner, on Melcombe Street -- where the miraculously light and airy quiches and first-rate salads would not be out of place in Paris, and are reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Regents Park and were thrilled. We found it easily accessable to everything you could possibly want to see in London via Baker street station and the "Tube", which connected easily to the overground trian, or the double decker buses. We happened to be there during the summer heat wave of the century and in a country that does not do air conditioning this could have been a problem. Howerever I found this charming hotel above average for the area and price. We had a room facing the courtyard and it was quiet and cool. The water pressure in the shower was good and though the room was small, typical for London, it accomodated us very nicely. The Regents Park restaurant is absolutely the best chinese food I have ever experienced. This is for real. It is a little pricey but believe me it is worth it. We were there for two weeks and we ate there every night except three. We never got tired of it. It was so good. I would recommend the restaurant if you are in London no matter where you decide to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Regent's Park Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 156 Gloucester Place, London NW1 6DT, England
